body:
â€œAida, the Movie,â€ the feature film spinoff of the wildly successful Spanish TV series â€œAida,â€ is crossing the Atlantic next year, a rare move for a broad Spanish comedy.

	Wiesner Distribution, marking 25 years as a leading distributor of Ibero-American cinema, will be releasing the ensemble comedy on Feb. 6 across the U.S., Puerto Rico, the Dominican Republic and Central Americaâ€™s Costa Rica, Guatemala, El Salvador and Panama. Paul Hudsonâ€™s Outsider Pictures partners with Wiesner on the U.S. release.
	

	This follows its Spanish theatrical release on Jan. 30 by Sony Pictures Entertainment Iberia. Â 


	Directed by Spainâ€™s Paco LeÃ³n, whose storied career in film and television kicked off with such comedic gems as â€œCarmina or Blow Up,â€ â€œKiki, Love to Loveâ€ and the â€œAidaâ€ series, the comedy reunites LeÃ³n with his original co-stars from the sitcom, including Carmen Machi, Miren Ibarguren, Mariano PeÃ±a, Eduardo Casanova, Pepe Viyuela, Melani Olivares, Canco RodrÃ­guez, Secun de la Rosa, David Castillo, Marisol Ayuso, Pepa Rus, Ã“scar Reyes and AdriÃ¡n Gordillo. They are joined by 96 other actors, mostly chosen via an open casting call on the filmâ€™s Instagram account.

	â€œAida, the Movieâ€ expands on the story of AÃ­da, a divorcÃ©e struggling to make ends meet while raising her teenage children in the fictional Madrid neighborhood of Esperanza Sur. The massive ensemble series ran from 2005 to 2014 on Spanish broadcast network Telecinco where it became a cult classic and helped launch the international careers of its lead actors.
	

	The movie is described as a â€œblend of fiction with meta-cinematic storytelling.â€ It takes place during the production of an episode of the series, wryfully blurring the boundaries between actors and characters, both on and off screen, while exploring themes like the limits of humor, the power of comedians and the complexities of fame.

	Outsider Pictures and Wiesner Distribution have often teamed up on U.S. theatrical releases, most recently on Gerardo Herreroâ€™s dramedy â€œUnder Therapy.â€ Their upcoming releases include the â€œThe Condorâ€™s Daughter,â€ which premiered at TIFF and was closed at this monthâ€™s Ventana Sur.

	â€œâ€™Aidaâ€™ is a beloved cultural phenomenon that became a massive television hit in Spain. Weâ€™re excited to bringÂ â€˜Aida, the Movieâ€™ to U.S. audiences and share a story whose humor connects effortlessly across cultures, grounded in heart and authenticity,â€ said Cynthia Wiesner, founder and president of Wiesner Distribution. 

	The pic is produced by Globomedia, part of The Mediapro Studio, and Telecinco Cinema, with the participation of Mediaset EspaÃ±a and MediterrÃ¡neo Mediaset EspaÃ±a Group.

	LeÃ³n, whose international credits include â€œThe Unbearable Weight of Massive Talentâ€ starring Nicolas Cage and Pedro Pascal, and Machi, whose credits include breakout hit â€œFuriousâ€ and Pedro AlmodÃ³varâ€™s â€œIâ€™m So Excited,â€ will be attending the comedyâ€™s Miami premiere on Feb. 5 next year.

title: â€˜The Officeâ€™ Star Melora Hardin â€˜Burst Into Tearsâ€™ When Fired From â€˜Back to the Futureâ€™ Amid Michael J. Fox Recasting Drama: â€˜A Huge Disappointmentâ€™
description: Melora Hardin, the actor best known for playing Jan Levinson on NBCâ€™s â€œThe Office,â€ recently told Entertainment Weekly that she â€œburst into tearsâ€ w
body:
Melora Hardin, the actor best known for playing Jan Levinson on NBCâ€™s â€œThe Office,â€ recently told Entertainment Weekly that she â€œburst into tearsâ€ when she was fired from Robert Zemeckisâ€™ blockbuster â€œBack to the Future.â€ While original Marty McFly actor Eric Stoltz  being let go from the production and replaced by Michael J. Fox is one of Hollywoodâ€™s most infamous re-casting, it turns out that decision led to a second firing. Hardin was originally cast as Martyâ€™s girlfriend Jennifer Parker.
	

	â€œâ€˜Back to the Futureâ€™Â was a huge disappointment. I was 17, you know. I burst into tears,â€ Hardin told EW. â€œIt was very sad. There were quite a few of those that I remember, you know, things that never really got made. But that I remember being very tough.â€


	HardinÂ revealed earlier this year that she also got the boot from â€œBack to the Futureâ€ when Stoltz was fired because studio executives thought she was too tall to star opposite Michael J. Fox. She explained: â€œâ€t was apparently the two female executives at the time that thought that it was emasculating for their lead male character to be in scenes with a woman that was taller than him. If I had done it, Iâ€™m sure it would have all gone in a different way. I wouldnâ€™t have doneÂ â€˜The Office.'â€

	â€œTo be where I am, you have to have failed more than youâ€™ve succeeded,â€ Hardin now told EW. â€œI think people donâ€™t realize that when they look at it from the outside â€” you have to really be somebody whoâ€™s comfortable with failure, and with putting yourself on the line all the time. That failure doesnâ€™t mean anything about you. You just have to fail better, and keep failing better â€¦ to be able to really weather this career choice.â€
	

	Stoltz and Hardin were in production for six weeks on â€œBack to the Futureâ€ when the decision was made to boot Stoltz and recast the lead role with the directorâ€™s first choice, Fox, who had originally been blocked from the film due to his commitment to the NBC sitcom â€œFamily Ties.â€ Hardin was replaced by Claudia Wells. Fox revealed in his new memoir, â€œFuture Boy,â€ that he wrote a letter to Stoltz asking to finally meet 40 years after the recasting.

	â€œEric has maintained his silence on the subject for 40 years, so I was prepared for the likelihood that heâ€™d prefer to keep it that way,â€ Fox writes in the memoir, noting the two had never come face to face to discuss the casting swap. Fox wrote to him: â€œIf your answer is â€˜piss off and leave me aloneâ€™â€¦ That works, too.â€

	Stoltz responded with a â€œbeautifully written replyâ€ that â€œbegan, â€˜Piss off and leave me alone!â€™ Thankfully, this was followed by â€˜I jestâ€¦â€™ Eric was thoughtful about my outreach, and although he respectfully declined to participate in the book, he seemed open to the idea of getting together.â€

	When Fox and Stoltz finally found themselves together in the same room, the actors â€œimmediately fell into an easy dialogue about our careers, families, and yes, our own trips through the space-time continuum,â€ Fox writes. â€œ[Stoltz entered] with a smile, and we quickly acknowledged that neither of us had an issue with the other. What transpired on â€˜Back to the Futureâ€™ had not made us enemies or fated rivals; we were just two dedicated actors who had poured equal amounts of energy into the same role. The rest had nothing to do with us. As it turned out, we had much more in common than our spin as Marty.â€

body:
â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ writer Jimmy Fowlie is asking for help finding his missing sister, Christina, who was last seen in Los Angeles. 

	Fowlie shared his sisterâ€™s photo and phone number on his Instagram page and asked that if anybody has seen her to contact the police. According to her missing person report, Christina was last contacted in late November.

	â€œMy sister has been missing and we are worried that she isnâ€™t safe,â€ Fowlie wrote. â€œHer married name is Downer but she may go by Christina Fowlie. Please share this so that if anyone has seen her, they can give any information to the police. The phone number is 213-996-1800 and her case number is 25237639. She was last seen in LA. Thank you.â€
	

	Several of Fowlieâ€™s â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ cast members, like Bowen Yang and Sarah Sherman, also shared his sisterâ€™s missing person report.


	Fowlie has been a writer on â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ since 2022â€™s Season Season 48. He co-wrote the viral â€œDomingoâ€ sketch starring cast member Marcello Hernandez and host Ariana Grande last year. Before â€œSaturday Night Live,â€ he was a member of the Groundlings improv and sketch comedy group and has acted on shows like â€œThe Comeback,â€ â€œ2 Broke Girls,â€ â€œThe Other Two,â€ â€œSearch Party,â€ â€œEnglish Teacherâ€ and more. He also co-wrote and starred in the Off Broadway musical â€œSo Long Boulder City.â€

	Last weekend, â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ aired its Christmas episode, hosted by Grande, and will return in January with host Finn Wolfhard and musical guest A$AP Rocky. It also marked Yangâ€™s final episode as a cast member.

title: â€˜Agonâ€™ Director Giulio Bertelli on How He Got Mubi To Board His Offbeat Allegorical Drama on Sports, Technology, and War
description: First-time Italian director Giulio Bertelli, who is fashion designer Miuccia Pradaâ€™s son, made what is probably this yearâ€™s most offbeat Italian fea
body:
First-time Italian director Giulio Bertelli, who is fashion designer Miuccia Pradaâ€™s son, made what is probably this yearâ€™s most offbeat Italian feature film debut with â€œAgon,â€ an allegorical drama that follows three female athletes competing in judo, fencing and target shooting within a fictional live-streamed global sports tournament called the Ludoj 2024 Games.

	â€œAgonâ€ (which takes its title from the Ancient Greek word for a struggle, contest or competition) was inspired by the historical figures of Joan of Arc, Cleopatra and a Russian cavalry officer called Nadezhda Durova. The experimental drama examines the social pressures of competitive sports, the use of technology and social media applied to sports, and the link between sports and war, providing a fresh and realistic look at contemporary athletic agonism.
	

	Â The film stars Italian judo athlete and Olympic Gold medalist Alice Bellandi and â€œLa Chimeraâ€ stars Yile Vianello and Sofija Zobina.Â 


	Following its premiere in the Venice Film Festivalâ€™s Criticsâ€™ Week in September, â€œAgonâ€ was released in Italian cinemas, kicking off Mubiâ€™s Italian theatrical release slate, and has travelled widely on the festival circuit including the Rio, Thessaloniki, Geneva, and Brisbane fests. 

	Bertelli speaks to Variety about his personal connection to the filmâ€™s subject matter and how he brought Mubi and The Match Factory on board as producer, Italian theatrical distributor, and global distributor.

	Youâ€™ve been involved with the Italian sailing team that competed in the Americaâ€™s Cup. Is that what prompted you to depict the world of highly competitive sports? 
	

	Yes, I definitely have a personal connection to this film. But there is also a broader context. Itâ€™s true that â€œAgonâ€ is centred around the world of sports. And of course itâ€™s open to interpretations. But I also use the sports world backdrop of these fictional Olympics that are almost a geopolitical platform, to make a reflection on the role that competitive sports have taken on over the past century. And also to talk more in general about the feeling in life of not being able to achieve oneâ€™s goal. So, at one level itâ€™s also the story of three teenagers who are unable to do what they want. This is observed very differently with respect to each character, â€‹â€‹contextualising this journey in the preparation for competition in a minor sports category of a hypothetical Olympics. Then thereâ€™s the broader issue of macro connections between how we came to call sports what they are today. Where does that comes from? And the relationship between war, violence, and sports.

	Talk to me about your decision to cast real life world champion judo athlete Alice Bellandi in the film.

	I initially conceived â€œAgonâ€ as an animation project. Then, when I decided to make it live-action, I had two big problems. One was: how do I give it a realistic flavour that establishes trust with the audience? For fencing, I knew I could use a stunt person because in fencing you wear a mask. With shooting, I also knew that it was not a big problem because the athlete has to be very still. But when it comes to judo, I knew I had to find a real judoka. Then reality surpassed my expectations when I met Bellandi, who agreed to be in the film. Then five months after we shot she won the Olympic gold medal in Paris.

	In simplistic terms, â€œAgonâ€ explores the relationship between sports and technology, which is very clear in  competitive sailing. Talk to me about how you weaved this into the filmâ€™s narrative. 

	Iâ€™m interested in the relationship between sports and technology, but in a broader sense, which is what I think Iâ€™ll continue to look at in the future. What really interests me is the rapport between the organic world and technology, â€œorganicâ€ pertaining to the body in this movie. One example is the surgery [scene] in the film, which is obviously a very crude scene. For me itâ€™s very important because itâ€™s not a metaphor. There are other directors who have addressed this theme [of technology and the body] using metaphorical devices that have shaped my imagination. But Iâ€™m fascinated by looking at this [rapport] where it doesnâ€™t exist as a metaphor, but exists purely as reality: a robot that digs into the flesh, into the blood.
	

	Talk to me about your relationship with Mubi. How did you bring them on board in such a big way?

	Actually, Mubi was involved in â€œAgonâ€ since the beginning, before anyone else. When I wrote this story as an animation project, I wasnâ€™t actually actively trying to get this film off the ground. I met Efe Cackarel in 2017 when Mubi was much smaller than it is now. We talked about it. I mentioned that I had this story in mind and Iâ€™d like to maybe make movies in the future. He said: â€œIâ€™m interested. Iâ€™m also interested in starting to produce in the future and not just be a platform. Why donâ€™t you write the screenplay?â€ So I wrote the screenplay and started talking about it directly with Mubi. At first we started developing it directly in London as an animation film, but then we realised that it would be too expensive and complex to do it as an animation project.

	Meanwhile, my life was changing. I thought: â€œmaybe this could actually be my first feature film. And Efe, rightly, said to me: â€œLook, you need you to find a producer to take this project forward. But we are on board.â€ So, with [Italian producer] Max Brun, I introduced myself to Jules Daley, who had just come out of RSA Films. She loved the project and decided to help me and become my producer on this film. So, little by little, â€œAgonâ€ was born. Then, when the project began to take shape, Mubi came on board. From the very beginning, there was the idea that they would distribute it. But they also became an equity investor. At that point, Mubi had acquired, or was in the process of acquiring, The Match Factory. So, to my great joy, I found myself working with The Match Factory as an international sales agent. Then they said: â€œInstead of selling the project, weâ€™ll distribute it directly in Italy, because they wanted to start distributing in Italy.â€Â 

	This interviewÂ has been edited and condensed for clarity.



	

									Courtesy Filmitalia

title: Chris Evans Returns for â€˜Avengers: Doomsdayâ€™ as Captain America With a Child, Teaser Confirms
description:
Cap is back â€” and heâ€™s a dad!

	Marvel Studios has finally dropped the first teaser trailer for â€œAvengers: Doomsdayâ€ online, after it aired in theat
body:
Cap is back â€” and heâ€™s a dad!

	Marvel Studios has finally dropped the first teaser trailer for â€œAvengers: Doomsdayâ€ online, after it aired in theaters last Thursday attached to initial screenings of â€œAvatar: Fire and Ash.â€

	The first teaser trailer has revealed that Steve Rogers, the star-spangled Avenger portrayed by Chris Evans, will return in the next Marvel team-up adventure, set to release Dec. 18, 2026. In a twist, Captain America is the father to a newborn child.
	

	Marvel is slowly building up to â€œDoomsday,â€ which hits theaters in a little less than a year. There will reportedly be more teasers that focus on other characters in the coming weeks. The Captain America trailer leaked online in the run-up to its theatrical debut, and a Thor-focused teaser also appeared in social media leaks this week. Itâ€™s expected that it too will run in theaters with showings of â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ beginning Thursday, like the Cap teaser.


	Joe and Anthony Russo, who previously directed â€œCaptain America: Winter Soldier,â€ â€œCaptain America: Civil War,â€ â€œAvengers: Infinity Warâ€ and â€œAvengers: Endgameâ€ and are back for â€œDoomsday,â€ released a short statement on their Instagram page.

	â€œThe character that changed our lives,â€ they wrote of Captain America. â€œThe story that brought us all here together. It was always going to come back to thisâ€¦â€




	The teaser, set on a peaceful farm, begins with Steve riding a motorcycle up to his home as a piano rendition of the â€œAvengersâ€ theme plays in the background. His blue helmet is reminiscent of his Captain America costume, which he pulls out to reminiscently admire. He holds a newborn baby and looks proudly, as the teaser ends with â€œSteve Rogers will return for â€˜Avengers: Doomsday.'â€ A countdown timer begins at the end thatâ€™s set to expire when â€œDoomsdayâ€ hits theaters.
	

	Marvel fans last saw Captain America, the founding Avenger, in the closing moments of 2019â€™s â€œAvengers: Endgame.â€ After saving the world from the purple villain known as Thanos, Cap makes it his personal mission to return the missing Infinity Stones to their rightful places across time. After finishing his time-traveling mission, an elderly Steve returns to the main MCU timeline and passes down his red-and-white Vibranium shield to his former sidekick, Sam Wilson (Anthony Mackie), upgrading him from the Falcon to the new Captain America. After bestowing his shield to Sam, Steve then goes back in time to reunite with his beloved Peggy Carter (Hayley Atwell).

	After Steve went missing and was frozen in the ice in the original â€œCaptain Americaâ€ movie, Peggy grew old but never stopped loving him. Now with the Quantum Realm time-traveling technology, the two were able to get married and live out their lives together through the decades. 

	Does this teaser mean that Steve somehow returns to the main MCU timeline to rejoin the Avengers? Is this the same Cap, or is he a variant of the elderly hero from the finale of â€œEndgameâ€? And whoâ€™s the baby. Does he or she have super-soldier powers like Cap? 

	Marvel also dropped the first poster for â€œDoomsday,â€ tinged in a green hue very similar to the colors of Doctor Doomâ€™s famous costume.


	Technically, this isnâ€™t Evansâ€™ first time back in the MCU since â€œEndgame.â€ In 2024â€™s billion-dollar smash â€œDeadpool & Wolverine,â€ he returned for a hilarious cameo as the Human Torch, his original superhero role way back in Foxâ€™s â€œFantastic Fourâ€ movie from 2005.

	In an Esquire profile of Mackie from earlier this year, ahead of the former Falcon taking on the Cap mantle in â€œCaptain America: Brave New World,â€ Evans said that he was â€œhappily retiredâ€ and denied reports that he would return to Marvel.

	â€œThatâ€™s not true,â€ Evans said about his rumored return at the time, explaining that these reports â€œhappen every couple yearsâ€ since he bowed out in â€œEndgame.â€

	â€œIâ€™ve just stopped responding to it,â€ he added. â€œYeah, no â€” happily retired!â€

	Evans isnâ€™t the only original â€œAvengersâ€ star who will be back for â€œDoomsday.â€ Robert Downey Jr. is returning, but not as Tony Stark. Instead, he is replacing his Iron Man armor to play the ultimate villain, Doctor Doom, in the multiverse-crossing movie. Other returning heroes include Chris Hemsworth as Thor, Mackie, Danny Ramirez, Sebastian Stan, Paul Rudd, Tom Hiddleston, Letitia Wright, Winston Duke, Simu Liu, Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, Florence Pugh, David Harbour, Wyatt Russell, Hannah John-Kamen and Lewis Pullman. From the â€œX-Menâ€ universe, Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Kelsey Grammer, Alan Cumming, James Marsden, Channing Tatum and Rebecca Romijn will cross over into the MCU.

title: â€˜Avatar 3â€™ to Rule Over Christmas Box Office; â€˜Anacondaâ€™ to Top Fellow New Holiday Releases â€˜Marty Supremeâ€™ and â€˜Song Sung Blueâ€™
description:
Theater owners are preparing for a very merry Christmas season.

	This holiday might not be one for the record books, but the lineup of films offers
body:
Theater owners are preparing for a very merry Christmas season.

	This holiday might not be one for the record books, but the lineup of films offers something important â€” a range of genres and styles â€” as exhibitors brace for whatâ€™s usually the busiest stretch of the year. Thatâ€™s an important distinction in post-COVID times. Since the pandemic, cinema operators have relied on one billion-dollar behemoth (â€œSpider-Man: No Way Homeâ€ in 2021 and â€œAvatar: The Way of Waterâ€ in 2022) or struggled with none at all (â€œAquaman and the Lost Kingdomâ€ floundered in 2023 and while â€œMufasaâ€ rebounded after a soft start in 2024, â€œThe Lion Kingâ€ prequel couldnâ€™t claw its way to the billion-dollar mark).
	

	This year, â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ will continue to dominate but James Cameronâ€™s sci-fi threequel wonâ€™t be alone in enticing audiences. Over the weekend, a trio of holiday releases â€” A24â€™s R-rated ping-pong adventure â€œMarty Supreme,â€ the Focus Features musical drama â€œSong Sung Blueâ€ and Sonyâ€™s disaster comedy â€œAnacondaâ€ â€” hope to cater to moviegoers young, old, or disinterested in returning to the alien planet of Pandora.


	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ is aiming for $55 million to $65 million over the traditional weekend and $75 million to $80 million through the four-day holiday frame. Those ticket sales would mark a 30% to 40% decline from its $89 million domestic debut. For context, â€œAvatar: The Way of Waterâ€ dropped by 52% in its sophomore outing after a significantly stronger $134 million debut. Disney and 20th Centuryâ€™s â€œAvatarâ€ franchise appears be experiencing diminishing returns, though itâ€™s important to remember these films arenâ€™t known for explosive opening weekends. Instead, â€œAvatarâ€ installments enjoy exceptional staying power, sticking around at the top of the box office for weeks on end. The first two films, which each ended up grossing over $2 billion globally, were No. 1 for seven consecutive weekends. Barring a surprise, â€œFire and Ashâ€ should remain atop the charts in North America well into the new year.
	

	In terms of new releases, Jack Black and Paul Ruddâ€™s â€œAnacondaâ€ is expected to lead the pack with $20 million from 3,400 venues between Christmas on Thursday and Sunday. â€œMarty Supremeâ€ is targeting $12 million to $20 million, while â€œSong Song Blueâ€ is projected to earn $10 million to $14 million from 2,400 theaters. In general, Christmas releases donâ€™t always deliver huge debuts but tend to play and play on the big screen into January and beyond.

	â€œAnacondaâ€ cost $45 million to produce. A meta-reboot, â€œAnacondaâ€ follows best friends who travel to the jungle to pursue their childhood dream of remaking their all-time favorite movie (you guessed it!) 1997â€™s â€œAnaconda.â€ The project starts to unravel when life imitates art and a real anaconda begins hunting them down. 

	â€œMarty Supremeâ€ had a rollicking start in limited release, breaking into the top 10 with $875,000 while playing on just six screens. Those initial returns are promising ahead of the nationwide expansion, which will test the $70 million-budgeted filmâ€™s commercial viability. It helps that TimothÃ©e Chalamet, who stars as the fictional table tennis champ Marty Mauser, has been rewriting the rules of movie marketingÂ in terms of getting out the word for an original film. â€œMarty Supremeâ€ has generated great reviews and encouraging word of mouth. Now the question is: Will Chalametâ€™s viral antics translate to ticket sales?

	â€œSong Sung Blueâ€ carries a modest $30 million production budget. Craig Brewer directed the film, featuring Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson in the true story of two down-on-their luck musicians who form a Neil Diamond tribute band. Varietyâ€™s chief film critic Owen Gleiberman praised â€œSong Sung Blueâ€ as â€œa winning pop nostalgia trip with a dark side.â€

	With just two weeks to go, overall domestic revenues are hovering at $8.37 billion, just 1.3% ahead of last year and 22.4% behind 2019, according to Comscore. Itâ€™s been a wobbly year with several hits (â€œLilo & Stitch,â€ â€œZootopia 2,â€ â€œA Minecraft Movieâ€ and â€œDemon Slayer,â€ among others) but not enough to offset a number of big-budget flops (â€œMission: Impossible â€“ The Final Reckoningâ€ and â€œSnow White,â€ to name a few). Projections for 2025 were already revised down to $9 billion, but after a brutal fall season, even that milestone feels like a stretch. Will these holiday offerings be able to deliver, or is the box office doomed to fall short of $9 billion for the second consecutive year?

title: Hideo Kojima Found Himself Unexpectedly Hooked on â€˜KPop Demon Huntersâ€™ â€” and â€˜Ended Up Crying My Eyes Outâ€™
description: Hideo Kojima is the mastermind behind hit action game franchise â€œDeath Stranding,â€ set in a desolate, post-apocalyptic world in which humanity is th
body:
Hideo Kojima is the mastermind behind hit action game franchise â€œDeath Stranding,â€ set in a desolate, post-apocalyptic world in which humanity is threatened by zombie-like ghost creatures called â€œBeached Things.â€ But heâ€™s also a big olâ€™ softie.

	Kojima, 62, recently revealed that he â€œcasuallyâ€ began streaming Netflixâ€™s global hit animated movie â€œKPop Demon Hunters.â€ He ended up loving it â€” and sobbing like a baby.


	â€œI casually started watching â€˜KPop Demon Hunters,â€™ got completely hooked, and ended up crying my eyes out by the end,â€ Kojima wrote in a post on X this week. â€œIt was so, so good ğŸ¥ºğŸ«¶â€
	

	Kojima also apparently is hooked on the filmâ€™s soundtrack, following up his original fanboy post with one featuring an image of Huntr/xâ€™s hit song â€œGoldenâ€ playing. In addition, the Japanese game design icon retweeted Varietyâ€˜s post naming â€œGoldenâ€ one of the best songs of 2025, which included this blurb: â€œLove it, hate it, will projectile-vomit if you hear it one more time in this or the next lifetime â€” whichever describes your reaction, you canâ€™t deny â€˜Golden,â€™ the most gigantic pop song in memory.â€

	â€œKPop Demon Hunters,â€ which is officially Netflixâ€™s most-watched movie ever, is produced by Sony Pictures Animation for Netflix. The companies have finalized a deal to bring out a sequel in 2029.

	From directors Maggie Kang and Chris Appelhans, â€œKPop Demon Huntersâ€ follows K-pop superstar trio Huntr/x, who when they arenâ€™t selling out stadiums use their secret identities as badass demon hunters to protect their fans from an ever-present supernatural threat. Together, they must face their biggest enemy yet: the Saja Boys, an irresistible rival boy band of demons in disguise.
	

	SEE ALSO: Hideo Kojima Talks â€˜Death Stranding 2â€™ and the Importance of Connection: â€˜Itâ€™s Not Connection With Headshots and Shooting Each Otherâ€™

title: â€˜Davidâ€™ Review: Handsome Animation but Standard-Issue Storytelling in Faith-Based Holiday Hit
description: If all you know or remember of the eponymous biblical characterâ€™s story is that he defeated a hulking giant with a humble slingshot, then â€œDavidâ€ mi
body:
If all you know or remember of the eponymous biblical characterâ€™s story is that he defeated a hulking giant with a humble slingshot, then â€œDavidâ€ might have some surprises in store for you â€” chief among them, the fact that the film continues for a full hour after this famous, seemingly climactic showdown. But the films of Angel Studios, by and large, are not for audiences only vaguely acquainted with the Bible, and this surprisingly slick animated feature will play best with viewers who can see its every narrative turn coming. That is a sizeable demographic: Released wide last weekend, Brent Dawes and Phil Cunninghamâ€˜s film overperformed notably at the box office, landing in the runner-up spot to â€œAvatar: Fire and Ash,â€ and aptly defeating relative toon Goliath â€œThe SpongeBob Movie: Search for SquarePants.â€
	

	This is all a perfectly on-the-nose outcome for a tale preaching the message that one must never underestimate the modest and pious when theyâ€™re up against the wealthy and decadent. (Or whatever moral descriptor applies to SpongeBob.) But â€œDavidâ€ attains its success by cribbing from the playbook of far mightier animation houses: There are shades here of Disney and DreamWorks â€” the latterâ€™s scripture-based hit â€œThe Prince of Egypt,â€ in particular â€” in everything from the filmâ€™s character design to its original song score, making for a proficient family entertainment thatâ€™s nonetheless a little too precision-engineered to feel truly stirring. Faith, â€œDavidâ€ has in spades; soul, not so much. 


	With Pixar-wide eyes and a mop of intricately tousled, treacle-brown hair, the young David (voiced by Brandon Engman) presents here as a plucky, intrepid moppet in the typical cartoon-hero mold. Heâ€™s introduced as a keen musician and lowly shepherdâ€™s son, dutifully minding his fatherâ€™s flock on the outskirts of Bethlehem, before swiftly launching into his generic â€œI wantâ€ song, the first of several peppily template-based but swiftly forgettable compositions by Grammy-winning Christian artist Jonas Myrin. Like any cutely drawn protagonist in his position, he yearns for bigger things, though he gets more than he bargained for when â€” after valiantly protecting his sheep from a preying lion â€” heâ€™s summoned before the Prophet Samuel (Brian Stivale), who anoints the nonplussed lad the future king of Israel.
	

	Meanwhile, the present king, the insecure and short-tempered Saul (Adam Michael Gold), is facing rejection by God and a declaration of war by preening Philistine monarch King Achish (British comedian Asim Chaudhry, offering something of a throwback to limp-wristed comic stereotypes). Enter David, brought into Saulâ€™s court to soothe the kingâ€™s anxieties with his deft lyre-playing, though the tyke soon proves an unexpected military asset: Cue the famed face-off against Goliath, which is quite dazzlingly staged in a vast field of scarlet poppies, petals spraying like confetti when the iceberg-sized monster hits the ground.

	Taking place around the 50-minute mark, this scene proves both the narrative and aesthetic peak of a film that, clocking in at an indifferently paced 110 minutes, could test the patience of younger children. Everything that happens after, as David grows into a strapping, stout-hearted man (now voiced by Christian singer-songwriter Phil Wickham) and eventually challenges Saul for the throne that is rightly his, is checked off in fairly rote fashion. Expanding on their 2023 Angel Studios miniseries â€œYoung David,â€ Dawes and Cunningham obviously hew closely to the Book of Samuel â€” this isnâ€™t the genre for significant creative license â€” but also to the familiar rules of any Hollywood heroâ€™s journey. 

	None of which would be a debit if their David had a little more personality of his own, but he remains a stubbornly dull anchor for the film, bound by the generally humorless, declamatory tone of the writing. Supporting characters are similarly lacking in wit or detail, while the filmâ€™s vocal performances (save for Chaudhryâ€™s odd caricature) are adequate but not especially distinctive. It follows that the faces on screen are perhaps the least characterful element of the filmâ€™s generally impressive visual design.

	Everything around them, however, is vividly realized, and occasionally even inspired. â€œDavidâ€ is nothing if not a spectacular showcase for the technical capabilities of South African animation house Sunrise Productions â€” demonstrated here both at a large scale, in the palpably dusty, sun-scorched vistas of ancient Israel, and in small, supple glimmers of fire and water. One musical number, â€œTapestry,â€ registers as a standout not for the song but for its visual treatment amid a busy weaving workshop overhung by cotton-candy bales of pastel-dyed wool. Indeed, textiles are perhaps the most consistent marvel of â€œDavid,â€ as even the ecru hessian of the title characterâ€™s shepherding smock is rendered with textured, tactile specificity. Reveling in the material may go somewhat against the filmâ€™s principles, but respecting the little things does not.

schema.headline: â€˜Davidâ€™ Review: Handsome Animation but Standard-Issue Storytelling in Faith-Based Holiday Hit

title: SF Drunk Woman Has Not Yet Pressed Charges Against Her Alleged Attackers
description:
SF Drunk Woman
                          I Got Bodyslammed & Tripped ...
body:
SF Drunk Woman
                          I Got Bodyslammed & Tripped ...
                          But Haven't Pressed Charges -- Yet!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 23, 2025
                            1:00 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 23, 2025
                                7:17 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The woman who went viral for her drunken brawl with bartenders in San Francisco is seemingly letting the cocktail connoisseurs off the hook ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          Shireen Afkari has certainly made a name for herself ever since a multi-angled video shows her at a restaurant -- arguing with employees and getting physical with patrons filming her -- and we are now told the bartenders who body-slammed and tripped Shireen have not been arrested by cops.
      
    
      
      NEW: Drunk female customer attacks bar staff outside trendy San Francisco restaurant co-owned by celebrity chef Joey AltmanThe unidentified couple had been cut off for being drunk and rudeBartender Miguel Marchese said they were verbally abrasive and difficult with staffâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/peqhRbKjqY
              @unlimited_ls
  
    
          SFPD PIO Robert Rueca tells TMZ ... there's no investigation into those two men for their actions in the video 'cause Shireen never filed a police report against them, even though footage shows them slamming her to the ground and seemingly tripping her on purpose.
      

          As we previously reported ... while she appeared to make a painful escape in the viral video, Afkari was located by officers and detained for public intoxication. She was then transported to the county jail.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          To make matters worse, she was fired from her job at Strava ... the fitness app company confirmed her firing via Instagram, saying "We don't condone violence of any kind and this does not reflect the standards we expect of our team. This past Monday, we made the decision to end the individualâ€™s employment."
      
    
          We reached out to Afkari for comment ... so far, no word back.

title: Travel Influencer Anunay Sood Cause of Death Revealed
description:
Influencer Anunay Sood
                          Cause of Death Revealed
body:
Influencer Anunay Sood
                          Cause of Death Revealed
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 22, 2025
                            4:21 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 22, 2025
                                5:37 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Travel influencer Anunay Sood died from a fatal mix and alcohol ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          The social media star's official cause of death is "combined fentanyl and ethanol toxicity" ... according to authorities in Clark County, Nevada, where he died.
      
    
          We're told the manner of death is accidental.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As you may recall ... the Dubai-based content creator was in Las Vegas on an all-expenses-paid trip last month when he died.
      
    
          Anunay was famous for his travel videos -- he had 1.4 million followers on Instagram -- and he also ran a marketing agency, Groundwork Solutions, and collaborated with tourism boards around the world.
      
    
          He was only 32.

title: Travis Kelce Leads NFL In Pro Bowl Fan Votes For Second Straight Year
description:
Travis Kelce
                          Most Pro Bowl Votes In NFL
                          ... S
body:
Travis Kelce
                          Most Pro Bowl Votes In NFL
                          ... Second Year In A Row!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 23, 2025
                            7:14 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 23, 2025
                                7:47 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Despite a rough year for Kansas City, Chiefs Kingdom and the Swiftes still made noise for Travis Kelce's chances in the NFL's Pro Bowl ... as the team announced Taylor Swift's fiancÃ© led the entire league in fan voting for the second consecutive year.
      
    
          The Chiefs shared the news on Tuesday morning ... hours after the submissions for the 2026 game were cut off. It hasn't been the best year for Kelce -- he has 803 yards and five touchdowns -- but we're assuming the voters weren't breaking down game footage when making their decision.
      
    
      
      â€” Kansas City Chiefs (@Chiefs) December 23, 2025
              @Chiefs
          
  
    
          Of course ... we all know it wasn't just Chiefs backers who helped Kelce achieve that mark -- but also the work of the Swifties, who have also infiltrated the fanbase amid the Swift/Kelce romance.
      

          Josh Allen finished second just behind Travis ... followed by New England's Drake Maye, with Chicago's Caleb Williams and Kevin Byard rounding out the top 5.
      
    
          If he ends up suiting up for the event, it would be the first time the 36-year-old plays in the game since the 2022 season ... which was the last time the Chiefs failed to make the Super Bowl.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The 2026 Pro Bowl games might mark the last one in Kelce's career ... as the franchise leader in touchdowns' contract is up at the end of the season -- and retirement is very much on the table.
      
    
          Those talks only intensified after Patrick Mahomes went down with an ACL tear two weeks ago, ending his 2025 and raising questions about his availability for the start of next season.
      
    
          When you factor in his recent comments, his looming wedding with Swift, and how he's already ventured into a career in Hollywood, it's fair to wonder if these next two weeks will mark Kelce's last.
      
    
          But we'll get that answer soon enough ... congrats, Trav!!

title: Video Shows 'Call of Duty' Creator Vince Zampella's Fatal Car Crash
description:
'Call of Duty' Creator
                          Video Shows Fatal Car Crash
body:
'Call of Duty' Creator
                          Video Shows Fatal Car Crash
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              December 22, 2025
                            5:15 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  December 23, 2025
                                5:45 AM PST
                                    
      
    
        
                    
                  
      
    
          New video shows the fatal car crash that killed "Call of Duty" video game creator Vincent Zampella ... and it looks like speed was definitely a factor.
      
    
          In the footage, obtained by TMZ, you see a red Ferrari come zooming out of a tunnel on the Angeles Crest Highway in Altadena, CA ... the sports car skids and crashes into the concrete barriers between the edge of the road and the San Gabriel Mountains.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Within a matter of seconds, a fireball erupts among the mangled car wreck ... and folks rush over and pull a body from the wreckage.
      

          The California Highway Patrol says there were two people in the car when it crashed ... a passenger who was ejected, and Vince, who they say was trapped. While we're not showing it, the video does show bystanders pulling the passenger away from the burning vehicle.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Look at the pavement ... there are tire and skid marks all over the road ... it's known to be a stretch of highway where people do all sorts of driving stunts.
      
    
          Vince was the head of Respawn Entertainment and the former CEO of Infinity Ward, the video game studio that created the hugely popular "Call of Duty" franchise.
